node.title: Myanmar junta charges U.S. journalist with terrorism and sedition
node.description: The new charges come on top of other accusations Danny Fenster has faced since his arrest in May, during a military coup, and they mean he could now face a life sentence.

node.title: Haiti water shortage: We pray for rain every day
node.description: A fuel shortage caused by gangs blocking distribution terminals is also affecting water supplies.

node.title: Prince Harry "warned" Twitter CEO of "coup" before January 6 attack
node.description: The royal, a frequent critic of all media, says he warned Jack Dorsey that his "platform was allowing a coup to be staged" in a January 5 email, and hasn't "heard from him since."

node.title: Man accused in Ahmaud Arbery killing changed his story, cops testify
node.description: Greg McMichael had blood on his hand from checking to see if the unarmed Black man had a gun on him after the shooting, one officer testified.

node.title: Japan train driver sues over 49 cents in docked wages
node.description: The tiny sum was docked after the man caused a one-minute delay to Japan's punctual train system.

node.title: Leon Panetta on top security threats to U.S.
node.description: Host Michael Morell discusses the way forward in Afghanistan and threats posed by Russia with Panetta and his former chief of staff, Jeremy Bash.

node.title: Rittenhouse was very distraught after shootings: defense witnesses
node.description: The focus is turning to whether he'll take the stand in his own defense. Experts say that might not be necessary.

node.title: Covid hotel split for family during Cyprus trip

node.title: Is India on track to meet its climate targets?

node.title: Man admits EncroChat £1.6m cocaine smuggling plot

node.title: Afghan army 'rife with ghost soldiers' before fall

node.title: Astroworld: Scott should have stopped concert earlier - fire chief

node.description: The Prime Minister's been a target of COVID-related hostility, forcing her to cancel several engagements.

node.description: And England hammered Tonga in a wrap of Sunday morning tests.

node.title: Labour to decide rules on how to replace Jacinda Ardern

node.title: Ardern says anti-vaxxers 'quite vocal', but wants Kiwis to 'talk openly about whatever concerns they might have'

node.title: Ardern says she's in it for a long time, not a 'good time' as opponent claimed
node.description: Ardern says she has no plans to step down anytime soon, amid speculation from the Opposition she's going to be replaced.

node.title: Ardern tells Aucklanders she's 'not going to keep you trapped over Xmas', but might if you're not vaccinated
node.description: Ardern says she won't open up parts of New Zealand with low vaccination rates just so she can have the Christmas holiday she wants.

node.title: 'Incorrect interpretation': National MP backs vaccine after accidentally appearing to endorse anti-vax views
node.description: Mark Mitchell says an email circulating online in which he appears to express anti-vax views was a mistake.

node.title: Anti-vax march sparks one of Parliament's biggest police operations but protesters cooled off before things went awry
